sen.j: 四辻 季遠（よつつじ すえとお、永正10年7月7日 (旧暦)（1513年8月7日） - 天正3年8月2日 (旧暦)（1575年9月6日）は、戦国時代 (日本)の公家・書家。
sen.e: Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI (August 7, 1513-September 6, 1575) was a Kuge (court noble) and calligrapher in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI (August 7, 1513-September 6, 1575) was a Kuge (court noble) and calligrapher in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Suetoo YOTSUTSUJI (August 17, 1513-September 16, 1575) was a Kuge (court noble) and calligrapher in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 初名は季規。
sen.e: His original name was Sueki.
His original name was Sueki.
His original name was Sueki.

sen.j: 父は四辻公音。
sen.e: His father was Kinoto YOTSUTSUJI.
His father was Kinoto YOTSUTSUJI.
His father was Kinoto YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 母は四辻実仲の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Sanenaka YOTSUTSUJI.
His mother was a daughter of Sanenaka YOTSUTSUJI.
His mother was a daughter of Sanenaka YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 息子は四辻公遠。
sen.e: His son was Kinto YOTSUTSUJI.
His son was Kinto YOTSUTSUJI.
His son was Kinto YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 孫娘に上杉景勝の側室桂岩院、後水尾天皇寵姫四辻与津子など。
sen.e: His granddaughters included Keigannin, concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI and Emperor Gomizunoo's favorite concubine, Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI.
His granddaughters included Keigannin, concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI, and Emperor Gomizunoo's favorite concubine, Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI.
His granddaughters included Keigannin, concubine of Kagekatsu UESUGI, and Emperor Gomizunoo's favorite concubine, Yotsuko YOTSUTSUJI.

sen.j: 官位は正二位権大納言。
sen.e: His official court rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
His official court rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional Major Counselor).
His official court rank was Shonii Gon Dainagon (Senior Second Rank, Provisional chief councilor of state).

sen.j: 永正14年（1517年）叙爵されたのをはじめ、享禄元年（1528年）侍従、天文 (元号)6年（1537年）参議、天文14年（1545年）権中納言、そして天文19年（1550年）には権大納言に叙任された。
sen.e: He was raised to the peerage in 1517 and appointed Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1528, Sangi (councilor) in 1537, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1545 and Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) in 1550.

He was raised to the peerage in 1517 and appointed Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1528, Sangi (councilor) in 1537, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1545, and Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) in 1550.
He was raised to the peerage in 1517 and appointed Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1528, Sangi (councilor) in 1537, Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1545, and Gon Dainagon in 1550.

sen.j: 駿河国の今川義元や太原雪斎と交友があり、ともに漢詩会などを催している。
sen.e: He maintained a friendship with Yoshimoto IMAGAWA and Sessai TAIGEN of Suruga Province and they held Kanshi (Chinese poem) parties and so on.
He maintained a friendship with Yoshimoto IMAGAWA and Sessai TAIGEN of Suruga Province and they held Kanshi (Chinese poem) parties and so on.
He maintained a friendship with Yoshimoto IMAGAWA and Taigen Sessai of Suruga Province and they held Kanshi (Chinese poem) parties and so on.
sen.cmt: 太原雪斎は僧名なので表記を変えました。

sen.j: また甲斐国にも度々下向しており、天文15年（1546年）5月の武田信玄（信玄）の家督相続に際しては三条西実澄と後奈良天皇倫旨を伝達し（『言継卿記』『冷泉為和集』）、甲府では積翠寺において季遠らを主客に連歌会が催されている。
sen.e: While he frequently visited Kai Province, at the time of succession by Shingen TAKEDA (Shingen) to the position of family head, he, with Sanezumi SANJONISHI, conveyed Rinshi (a document from Emperor) ("Tokitsugu Kyoki" (Dairy of Tokitsugu YAMASHINA) and "Reizei Tamekazu shu") and in Kofu, renga-kai (a gathering of linked verse) was held at Sekisui-ji Temple with attendance of chief guests including Suetoo.

While he frequently visited Kai Province, at the time of succession by Shingen TAKEDA (Shingen) to the position of family head, he, along with Sanezumi SANJONISHI, conveyed Rinshi (a document from Emperor) ("Tokitsugu Kyoki" (Dairy of Tokitsugu YAMASHINA) and "Reizei Tamekazu shu") and in Kofu, renga-kai (a gathering of linked verse) was held at Sekisui-ji Temple with attendance of chief guests including Suetoo.

While he frequently visited Kai Province, at the time of succession by Shingen TAKEDA (Shingen) to the position of family head, he, along with Sanezumi SANJONISHI, conveyed Rinshi (a document from Emperor) ("Tokitsugu Kyoki" (Dairy of Tokitsugu YAMASHINA) and "Reizei Tamekazu shu") and in Kofu, renga-kai (a gathering of linked verse) was held at Sekisui-ji Temple with attendance of chief guests including Suetoo.
sen.cmt: and の後のスペース短縮

sen.j: また、天文16年には塩山向嶽寺開祖の抜隊得勝に対し禅師号を贈る際にも取次を務め、天文21年（1552年）には要件は不明であるものの勅使として下向しており、一貫して武田氏との取次を務めている。
sen.e: While he played a role as mediator at the time of giving Zenshi-go to Tokusho BASSUI, the founder of Enzan Kogaku-ji Temple in 1547 and in 1552 left Kyoto as Imperial envoy for unknown purposes, he consistently functioned as mediator relating to the Takeda clan.

While he played a role as mediator at the time of giving Zenshi-go to Tokusho BASSUI, the founder of Enzan Kogaku-ji Temple in 1547, and in 1552 left Kyoto as Imperial envoy for unknown purposes, he consistently functioned as a mediator relating to the Takeda clan.

While he played a role as mediator at the time of giving Zenji-go (a title given to honorable priests) to Bassui Tokusho, the founder of Enzan Kogaku-ji Temple in 1547, and in 1552 left Kyoto as Imperial envoy for unknown purposes, he consistently functioned as a mediator relating to the Takeda clan.
sen.cmt: Zenshi-go→Zenji-go 説明も補足しました。「抜隊得勝」僧名のため表記変更

sen.j: 天正3年（1575年）伊勢国で客死。
sen.e: He died abroad in Ise Province in 1575.
He died abroad in Ise Province in 1575.
He died abroad in Ise Province in 1575.

sen.j: ※日付は旧暦
sen.e: *The dates are under the old lunisolar calendar.
*Dates are under the old lunisolar calendar.
*Dates are under the old lunisolar calendar.

sen.j: 1517年（永正14年）1月26日、従五位下に叙位。
sen.e: He was raised to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 26, 1517.
He was raised to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) on January 26, 1517.
January 26, 1517: He was raised to Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 時に諱は季規。
sen.e: At that time, his Imina (personal name) was Sueki.
At that time, his Imina (personal name) was Sueki.
At that time, his Imina (personal name) was Sueki.

sen.j: 1528年（大永8年）3月22日、侍従に任官。
sen.e: On March 22, 1528, he was appointed Jiju.
On March 22, 1528, he was appointed Jiju.
March 22, 1528: He was appointed Jiju.

sen.j: 時に諱は季遠。
sen.e: At that time, his Imina was Suetoo.
At that time, his Imina was Suetoo.
At that time, his Imina was Suetoo.

sen.j: 4月5日、従五位上に昇叙し、侍従如元。
sen.e: On April 5, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and retained his position as Jiju.
On April 5, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and retained his position as Jiju.
On April 5, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and retained his position as Jiju.

sen.j: 年月日不詳、左近衛少将に転任。
sen.e: Date unknown, transferred to Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
Date unknown, transferred to Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
Date unknown, transferred to Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1530年（享禄3年）8月18日、正五位下に昇叙し、左近衛少将如元。
sen.e: On August 18, 1530, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no shosho.
On August 18, 1530, he was promoted to Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no shosho.

sen.j: 1533年（天文 (日本)2年）4月17日、従四位下に昇叙し、左近衛少将如元。
sen.e: On April 17, 1533, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no shosho.
On April 17, 1533, Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no shosho.
April 17, 1533: He was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no shosho.

sen.j: 1535年（天文4年）1月3日、左近衛中将に転任。
sen.e: On January 3, he was transferred to Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
On January 3, he was transferred to Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
January 3: He was transferred to Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 1536年（天文5年）11月22日、従四位上に昇叙し、左近衛中将如元。
sen.e: On November 22, 1536, Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.
On November 22, 1536, Jushiijo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.

sen.j: 1537年（天文6年）7月13日、参議に補任し、左近衛中将如元。
sen.e: On July 13, 1537, appointed to Sangi and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.
On July 13, 1537, appointed to Sangi and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.

sen.j: 12月12日、正四位下に昇叙し、参議左近衛中将如元。
sen.e: On December 12, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.
On December 12, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sakone no chujo.
On December 12, he was promoted to Shoshiinoge (Senior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and retained his position as Sangi and Sakone no chujo.

sen.j: 1538年（天文7年）3月8日、土佐権守を兼任。
sen.e: On March 8, 1538, he was additionally appointed Tosa no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Tosa Province).
On March 8, 1538, he was additionally appointed Tosa no Gon no kami (Provisional Governor of Tosa Province).

sen.e: On January 5, 1539, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and retained his positions as Sangi, Sakone no chujo and Tosa no Gon no kami.
On January 5, 1539, he was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and retained his positions as Sangi, Sakone no chujo, and Tosa no Gon no kami.

sen.e: On March 10, 1542, he was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and retained his positions as Sangi and Sakone no chujo.

sen.j: 5月、日向国（守護職：島津貴久）に下向。
sen.e: In May, he visited Hyuga Province (Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable): Takahisa SHIMAZU).
In May, he visited Hyuga Province (Shugoshiki (post of provincial constable): Takahisa SHIMAZU).

sen.j: 10月、帰洛。
sen.e: In October, he returned to Kyoto.

sen.e: In 1543, he visited Echizen Province (Shugoshiki: Takakage ASAKURA (10th head)).

sen.j: 但し、本座を聴される。

sen.e: On August 2, he died in Ise Province.
